message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with the task of localizing an image region described by a natural language expression, which is a problem in computer vision (CV). The paper proposes a novel model called the Modular Attention Network (MAttNet) that utilizes attention mechanisms to decompose expressions into modular components related to appearance, location, and relationship to other objects. This suggests that the paper could be categorized under cs.CV. However, the paper also heavily relies on natural language processing (NLP) techniques such as word/phrase attention and language-based attention, indicating that it could also be categorized under cs.CL. The use of attention mechanisms and the end-to-end framework also suggests that the paper could be categorized under cs.AI and cs.LG. Finally, the task of referring expression comprehension involves retrieving relevant information from a large dataset, which could be categorized under cs.IR.
